cs3500.music.model

Interface IjMidiEvent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JMidiEvent

    public interface IjMidiEvent
    The interface Represents an interface for a midi event inside a MIDI track. This events usually represent NOTES but sometimes will also represent other events in the composition, such as not-NOTE related events like percussive instructions. For further expansion once the keyboard view is finished, I decided to keep the technical term.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getChannel()
      Retrieves the channel of the event (where the midi message is coming from or where is supposed to head at).
      int getDuration()
      Retrieves the duration of the event (how long the key or trigger was held).
      int getPitch()
      Retrieves the absolute pitch of the event.
      int getTick()
      Retrieves the tick of the event.
      int getVelocity()
      Retrieves the velocity of the event (how hard the key was pressed).

    • Method Detail

      • getTick

        int getTick()
        Retrieves the tick of the event. - A 'Tick' the standard measure we will use to store note changes, this changes will then be synchronized with the actual tempo of a composition. A tick is fixed to represent 120 BPM.

      • getPitch

        int getPitch()
        Retrieves the absolute pitch of the event. This pitch doe not take the octave ina count, this will be handled by the assigned virtual instrument in the track.

      • getVelocity

        int getVelocity()
        Retrieves the velocity of the event (how hard the key was pressed).

      • getChannel

        int getChannel()
        Retrieves the channel of the event (where the midi message is coming from or where is supposed to head at).

      • getDuration

        int getDuration()
        Retrieves the duration of the event (how long the key or trigger was held).
